title: Presidential Nominations sent to the Senate, 5-14-2009 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




May 14, 2009

 



Presidential Nominations sent to the Senate, 5-14-2009




 THE WHITE HOUSE Office of the Press Secretary  ________________________________________________  For Immediate Release                        May 14, 2009 NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE: Aboard Air Force One  En Route Washington, D.C.  Aneesh Chopra, of Virginia, to be an Associate Director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy, vice Richard M. Russell, resigned. Capricia Penavic Marshall, of the District of Columbia, to be Chief of Protocol, and to have the rank of Ambassador during her tenure of service, vice Nancy Goodman Brinker, resigned
